meanings.definition: To believe or consider to be responsible for something
meanings.sent1: She credited her friend for helping her with the project.
meanings.sent2: I credited my brother with breaking the vase.
meanings.sent3: The detective credited the cat for solving the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The teacher credited the student for the creative solution.
meanings.sent5: He credited his lucky charm for winning the game.

meanings.definition: To give recognition or acknowledgment to someone for their work or actions
meanings.sent1: The boss credited Sarah for her hard work on the project.
meanings.sent2: The company credited the employees for their dedication.
meanings.sent3: The comedian credited the audience for the laughter.
meanings.sent4: The coach credited the team for their victory.
meanings.sent5: The author credited the inspiration for the novel to her travels.

meanings.definition: To add money to an account or balance as a payment or deposit
meanings.sent1: I credited my account with the bonus I received.
meanings.sent2: The bank credited the interest to the savings account.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper credited the customer's account for the returned item.
meanings.sent4: The company credited the payment to the supplier.
meanings.sent5: She credited her account with the money she earned from the sale.
